1. This road sign means:
2. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
3. This sign means drivers should:
column4: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column6: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column10: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.

column2: 4. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 5. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 6. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column4: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.

column2: 7. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
8. This sign indicates that:
column4: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column6: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column10: there is a school zone after the curve.

column2: 9. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 10. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
11. Aggressive drivers:
column6: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. This road sign means:
14. Alcohol:
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 15. If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time:
column6: the vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
column8: the driver on the left must signal the driver on the right to go.
column10: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 16. This white sign means you:
column4: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column6: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column8: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.

column2: 17. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 18. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 19. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column10: have a beer or two to keep you awake.

column2: 20. A yellow arrow means:
column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.

column2: 21. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
22. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
23. This road sign means:
24. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column4: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.
column10: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.

column2: 25. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: sound their horn to warn other drivers.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 27. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: stay in the center of your lane
column8: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 28. This sign indicates:
column8: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column10: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 29. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 30. Emergency vehicles:
column6: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.
column8: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.

column2: 31. When the pavement is marked with a double yellow line, drivers may pass other vehicles:
column4: only if there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: only if the vehicle ahead is driving 10 mph or more under the speed limit.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 32. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
33. Parking is allowed:
column6: within 10 feet of a fire hydrant.

column2: 34. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
35. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to know when it is safe to cross.
column6: to suddenly run into the street.
column8: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column10: not to cross unless they are with an adult.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
37. Warning signs normally are:
38. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 39. Roads can be very slippery:
column4: when it has just started raining.

column2: 40. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.
